elements.text: [Part One]
(Aboriginal background music. The man speaks with shortened vowels and an upward lift at the end of the
sentence. Welcome to Australia?)

(loudhailer) Attention. This is Chief Coordinator Whitten. Assemble decently for the collection process, or you will be forcibly removed. You leave me no alternative. Attention. This is your last chance.
Nearer

You give me no choice. Damn it! That's it. Time to send in the troops. You heard me. Have the squads cordon off a section and get two thousand of these people into the enclosures. Use tear gas if they have to. It's time to break up this shanty town.
Crowd protesting, glass smashes. Device fired, canister rolls, consternation as smoke hisses.

(loudhailer) Your continued resistance has forced my hand. Do not interfere with public operations. No one will be harmed. This is for your own good. This is for the good of your people. Damn. How many times have I heard that before? For all the good it does. Listen to them. Wait. Driver, stop. Kill the engine.
A faint roaring sound.
Listen.
Louder rumbling.
What the hell is that?
Crowd crying out, cracking of ground.
Hell! The whole damn Earth is waking up. Get us out of here. Pull our men back.
Rumbling and cracking of ground.
Come on, man. Oh God, it's too late. It’s too late for us all!
Crowd crying out as rumbling continues.
Faint whistling of the wind. The Tardis materialises. Tardis door opens.
Time for a stroll. Stretch our legs and take in the fresh air.
Inhaling. Tardis door closes.
That's if it's fresh.
Well, we're breathing it already. Wow!
Yeah. Wow is right, and then some.
Quiet though. Can't we come back in the daytime?
I'm afraid the night is here to stay for a while yet. Notice the way the stars shift from blue to red. We're out in the depths of space, travelling.
It's funny. Expect them to be zipping by, you know, like Star Trek.
Walking off.
All of space, just staring down at you between the buildings. Makes you feel like you're really part of the universe, doesn't it?
Yeah. Next to nothing between us and certain death.
(laughs) You soon get used to that if you hang around the Doctor long enough.
I imagine there's a powerful forcefield shielding the city from open space. An invisible dome, an airtight bubble.
Yeah well, I just hope the breeze isn't down to seepage. It's a bit on the nippy side.
I imagine if there were any kind of breach, the air would do more than seep out.
What sort of place is this?
Looks like Manhattan uprooted and took off into space.
Well, I wouldn't rule it out entirely.
You're not serious? A whole city just floated up and launched into space? He's not serious, is he?
He's not serious. Still, that's exactly what it looks like. Then again, things aren't always what they...
Stops walking.
Weird. Don't remember seeing anything like them in Manhattan.
Tell me they're not part of some street mime.
Tapping.
No. Perfectly inert, I'd say. Like standing stones.
What was that? Something moving there, on, on top of that one.
Some sort of lizard?
A thorny devil. Commonly known as the moloch.
Moloch?
Mmm, Moloch. One of Milton's devils. Calls to mind Paradise Lost.
Well, if this is Paradise, something tells me we should have found it sooner, before it fell into such a state of disrepair.
Or decay.
Well, I'm sure I've seen one of those lizards before. One of those David Attenborough programmes on TV.
And they're from where, exactly?
Australia. Actually, I'm more interested in the stone it was basking on.
Yeah. Basking in complete lack of sunshine.
Hmm. Like baked clay, but softer.
Not up to much if they can't withstand a few pokes of an umbrella. Anyway, they can't be standing stones, can they? What kind of city council puts up standing stones in the middle of the street?
Some sort of traffic calming? Sleeping policemen?
Except there's no traffic to calm.
And that's another thing. A city this size? There ought to be some sort of noise, even at night.
Yeah, not to mention more street lights.
Yes. Very few of them are on. And it looks like nobody's home.
Hey Doctor, there's, there's something on the other side of this stone. And this one.
What's caught her eye now, I wonder?
Don't know. Probably just a ... It's ... My God. It's a face.
The resemblance is very crude. Still, in a certain light I suppose it is somewhat suggestive.
Crude doesn't do it justice. There's faces in all of these. Look. Every one of them.
They look like they're screaming.
Yeah, I was hoping nobody else’d notice that.
It's horrible. I don't like them.
Seconded.
Too crude to be carved, certainly.
Too much like a face to be natural.
Who's to say what's natural in a place like this?
Yeah, well, they give me the creeps.
A ghost town, with stone ghosts.
City of the dead.
Hey, steady on. Which one of you's life and which one's soul?
Excuse me?
Of the party. Neither of you is exactly lifting me spirits here.
Yes well, let's just hope that yours are the only spirits waiting to be raised, hmm?
Hey, that’s so not funny.
In any case, perhaps the party will be warming up soon. Look to the stars. For a dead city this place is attracting a fair few visitors. Look.
Where? Oh my God. That spaceship?
Well, whoever they are, I hope they're friendly for a change.
That's a spaceship. I mean, a real spaceship?
Hopefully piloted by someone who knows what this place is all about.
They may be as much in the dark as we are.
Still, can't do any harm to find out. Come on. Judging by their approach they look to be landing a few blocks from here.
Stay close, both of you. Stay very close.
Actual spaceship. Okay!
Spaceship engines. Electronic door operating.
Well, Commander Korshal?
Preliminary survey is complete. No communications, minimal power sources. I will be commencing our approach in a few moments.
And the forcefield? Will it present any danger to our vessel?
There is no detectable forcefield.
There must be, to contain an atmosphere on an asteroid of that size.
The atmosphere is tolerable and stable. Something maintains its presence.
The structures confirm it was once inhabited.
Once, perhaps. But we have yet to detect signs of life.
Perhaps the life signs, like the forcefield, are indetectable.
We shall soon see. Secure yourself in your seat. Helm, take us in.
Hey, check these out.
Hex. Didn't anyone ever teach you two the Green Cross Code? Look before you cross the road.
I don't think these cars are going to be running anyone over. This place gets weirder and weirder.
Okay. They look like cars, as much as those faces look like faces. But who's going to carve cars out of
Stone. They stone. And there's more of those figures over there.
More crude effigies. Wrinkled like old bark or old skin.
Hah - drop of Oil of Olay from the Tardis and they'll ... Doctor, what's got into...
I told you to look, didn't I, before you cross the road. Take a good look, both of you, at the end of this street, and tell me you've not seen that horizon somewhere before.
That's not ... I mean ... Can't be.
I'm afraid it must be. Landmarks are meant to be identifiable, even if you stumble across them in the most unexpected of places. Uluru.
What?
Uluru.
Otherwise known as Ayers Rock.
Spaceship landing. Hissing, doors opening, many walking down metal walkway.
Troopers, fan out. It is unlikely we will find anything, but we must observe procedure.
Grunting of troopers.
An urban desert. And these structures look to have been subjected to some decay. Dead, Vresha. This entire rock is dead.
But the atmosphere is stable. And if they have suffered some disaster, their needs will be all the greater. The prospects for trade are still
Trade depends on there being survivors.
Well, if there are no survivors then this place may be claimed as salvage.
Well, there is the mysterious forcefield technology, I suppose.
And the gravitics, Korshal. Zero energy emissions. A gravity field far in excess of natural for an asteroid of this mass and density. Propulsion might well be gravitic too.

If the technology is that far in advance of our own, then we had best hope that there are no survivors. Salvage will be a lot more advantageous than trade terms, and (beeps) Movement. Directly ahead. Ready weapons! Well Vresha, it looks like trade, not salvage after all. We are not alone.
Ayers Rock, at the end of a dead street, on an asteroid, in deep space. That's different.
I'd like to know what we're all on. And I'm not talking about the asteroid.
Ace, Mister Hex, believe your eyes.
Appearances can be deceptive.
I wish they were. But if wishes were horses
They'd probably be turned to stone like everything else here.
Is that what you think's happened? You think these are real cars, real people?
What else can they be?
Doctor, is she on the right track?
I think we're all of us on the wrong track. The Tardis has strayed.
Hmm. Nothing new there.
This is different.
Different? How?
It's wrong, in a way I can't describe. It's quite possible this city isn't dead at all.
Well, that's good. Isn't it?
No. It's bad. Worse. And if Uluru is really there at the heart of the city, then I have an idea of what these stone figures might be.
Which is?
Well, I can't be sure, and until I am. In the meantime, we might be regarded as trespassers, so it's best to tread very carefully. Come on.
Bleeps.
Troopers, stand ready. Show yourself! We mean you no harm!
A weapon is primed.
But there is no harm in being prepared.
Please, don't shoot.
Human.
Please, help.
Thank God you've come.
Trooper, search her.
Sir.
I'm unarmed.
Explain yourself. What help do you need? We are traders from the Galyari Clutch. We wish to negotiate an exchange of goods.
Traders? Trade? There's no trade. You have to get me out of here, get me off this damn rock. There's nothing to trade. They're all dead! Can't you see that? They're all dead!
Doctor? I thought you said we should meet that ship.
Can't you see he's changed his mind? Doctor's prerogative and all that.
I didn't change my mind. This did.
Tapping stone.
Uluru.
(sighs) It's breath-taking.
Breath-taking's not my favourite word when there's only a forcefield between us and deep space.
A forcefield, or something. Unfortunately, that's just one of the too many questions that has to wait its turn. This, this is the real puzzle. I think we should take a walk round the perimeter.
Oh, that'll take hours.
Well, we're not going anywhere else, are we?
Until we have some answers, no. There's too much here that's wrong.
See? Sounds like a good argument for leaving.
Yeah, you'd think so, wouldn't you?
There are matters of gravity, for one thing.
Excuse me?
An asteroid little more than thirty kilometres in diameter. No signs of especially advanced technology. What does the gravity feel like to you?
Normal.
We should all feel lighter or something, shouldn't we?
Very much so.
Well, if it's any consolation, I've shed a few kilos through sweat and stress.
Then a few more won't hurt. This way, I think.
Come on, then. Best keep an eye on him.
McShane, Ace, wait. Stop.
What?
Can’t shake this feeling, like someone's watching our every move.
Yeah, I know what you mean. Ha, maybe it's the stones, eh?
(distant) Are you two coming? We trespassers need to stick together.
Take your time and answer our questions.
We have to get out of here.
(growls) We will go when we are ready. If you do not calm yourself and tell us...
You don't scare me.
We are not trying to. However, Commander Korshal deserves your respect. If we cannot trade in goods, then you can at least give that much in return for your safe passage off this asteroid.
Asteroid? It's, it's not! You're right. I'm sorry, it's been, it...
I'm Trade Negotiator Vresha. What is your name?
Toomey. Leanne Toomey. I, I'm, I was an engineer, I don't know what I am now. I've, I've been on my own, alone all this time.
How long? What has happened here?
Weeks. Days. I'm not sure, but it's felt like years. It started slow, but it's all been happening so fast, seems like, I don't know when. It's a nightmare! We have to go!
You are an engineer. What technology powers this colony? What propulsion systems?

What? I don't know, I was a mining engineer. I guess there's engines buried down there somewhere. They never let us near. You think they're just going to let just anyone wander down around there, around crucial systems like that? You're mad. What does it matter? The place is dead. Dead!
So what are we looking for?
Paintings.
Couldn't we just go to the Tate or something? I mean, they have weird sculptures and everything.

Cave paintings. The art of certain cultures can be a mine of information, a record of history and more besides. I'm hoping we might find some newer examples, something that might tell us what happened here.
Newer cave paintings?
They might have upgraded to DTP by now.
You might think so, but there's something here that tells a different story, a sense of something ancient.
Ancient, and Creepsville.
Now who's dampening our spirits?
Sorry.
This entire place is a fiction. Something stranger besides.
Stranger than fiction? Oh, truth, you mean.
A version of it, at least. We're standing on it. Our feet are on terra firma. Ergo, it must be the truth. Just because it doesn't happen to fit in with our own version.
So where are we, then? Some sort of dreamland?
Listen?
Faint noise of a vehicle in the distance.
What now?
Some sort of car.
Electric, by the sounds of it. Well, at least some laws of physics still apply.
Shot fired.
Get down!
Why is it everywhere I go with you two I get shot at?
No, it's all right. They're firing into the air.
Two more shots fired.
Warning shots. Raise your hands. As a sign of meaning no harm, it's surprisingly universal.
Well, you might want to lower that umbrella, in case they mistake it for a weapon.
They're human. And their vehicle looks very like a jeep, wouldn't you say? There's a remote chance they'll recognise a device for keeping the rain off.
Another shot fired.
They like to drive home the point, don't they?
Vehicle stops.
Shh. Greetings. How do you do? I'm the Doctor, and this is...
A pair of Aussies speak.
(man) Move away from Uluru.
(woman) Just get them on board.
We were just coming.
Save it for later. I'm Mulyan. That's Wahn. Get in the car.
Well, if you're going our way.
And what is your way?
Perhaps if you'd care to tell us something of what's happening here, I might be able to tell you.
(growl) If everyone here is dead, then who is shooting?
I don't know, I haven't seen anyone. Dream Commandos, maybe.
Dream Commandos? Dreamers and warriors I understand, but the combination is unclear. What are they?
They, they're fighters. Soldiers. Special forces to hold back the Dreaming. They, they did all they could, but it was way too late and you can't fight it. You can't fight any of it.
(growl) What is this Dreaming?
We understand nightmares.

Understand? You can't even begin to. I, I can't explain it to you. It's all around us. It's put the city to sleep and there's nobody left. Maybe a few of them survived, a few stragglers at most, but they're lost. We're all lost.
If these warriors are fighting a threat, then we will offer our aid. Lock her in the ship.
No. Bring her. If there is trade to be transacted, she will be our liaison.
You're mad! I'm not going back into the city.
You are. And you will have our protection. Move out! Troopers, fan ahead! Stay alert!
You're making a big mistake.
Vehicle moving.
I suppose proper introductions are in order. I'm the Doctor, this is Ace and this is Hex.
How did you come here?
Was that your ship we saw descend over Whitten Plaza?
No, you won't have seen us land, but you certainly do have some other visitors.
Why do they come? Why do any of you come now?
Perhaps to help, in your time of need.
Looks like you could use some.
It's a bad time. The dawn comes. A dawn that means the end for us all.
But you're alive. You're surviving. There must be others.
Must there?
Maybe there are, somewhere in the city. A handful at most.
What is happening here, Mulyan?
It is the Dreaming.
Hey! What's that?
Look out!
They crash.
The human is right, Korshal. There is evil here.
I know. It hides in the shadows.
Weapon fired, Trooper grunts.
What is it?
Oh, hell. They're onto us.
Korshal!
Stay back. Troopers, defensive positions! There! The silos! Fire!
Automatic fire.
We're finished. Finished! You can't fight those things. I'm not staying here to watch you all die.
Toomey! Come back! (roars)
Get after her. Troopers, move out!
Ace? Hex? Are you all right?
Doctor. What happened? What... Ace! Doctor, she's out cold.
Taken a nasty knock.
The spirit is still within. She'll live.
Ace groans.
Easy, McShane. Lie still. What hit us? What was that thing in the road?
Bunyip.
Bunyip? Sounds as if they're meant to be cute.
I think you've been listening to the wrong grapevine.
They're devil spirits. Monsters from the Dreamtime.
There are more out there. We can't stay here.
Grunts of creatures start up in the background.
What about Ace?
We'll move her, gently.
Doctor, take the rifle.
Thank you, no.
Help me lift her.
No time. They'll pick off the weakest of us.
God. They're not cute at all, are they?
Ah, where is she?
She is unarmed and alone. According to her own account, she will not last long without our protection.
Humans are resourceful. She stayed alive and alone this long.
Do you believe her stories? There were creatures moving in the shadows back there. Teal creatures, not dreams.
Nightmares and reality can coincide.
Do humans have a race memory?
I don't know. Humanity is comprised of many diverse cultures, all of them a mystery to me.
There is an enemy here, but is anyone worth saving?
We will see. Let us find these warriors.
Hex, stand behind me.
What about Ace? We can't leave her in the car.
Just do as I say!
Will those guns do any good?
The shadow beasts fear the sound of the bullet, the shock wave as it tears through the air.
But they learn not to fear.
We have other weapons. They're in the car.
If it's sonic waves they fear, then I may have a little something up my sleeve or in my pocket.
Doctor! Watch out!
It's all right, I think they're a little wary of me. Just a few minor adjustments...
Someone's coming!
(nearby) Oh God, help me. They're all around us.
Get back.
Who's she?
A civilian. A survivor.
Stay back!
No, no. Er, over here. Er, leave her alone.
Doctor!
Nooo!
Silence.
Where'd they go?
The Bunyips have returned to the shadows.
But the Doctor? And that woman?
There's nothing we can do for either of them now. See? They stand before you, there, and there.
What? What are you talking about? The, the stones?
They're gone from us. They are inapatua.
Your Doctor is lost. He sleeps in stone.
